title: Remembering Robert Badinter, France’s Minister of Justice, who was shaped by the Holocaust – HAMEC Blog

quotes: Robert Badinter was a French lawyer, politician, and author who enacted the abolition of the death penalty in France in 1981, while serving as Minister of Justice under François Mitterrand.
Until 1981, the guillotine continued to be used as the means of implementing death sentences in France. However, in that year, France abolished the death penalty.
